metadata.title: CVE-2019-9800 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 66, Firefox ESR 60.6, and Thunderbird 60.6. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and FirefoxESR < 60.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu3').
